Key Match Events: Pete Alonso hit a three-run home run in the first inning
The Mets scored eight runs in the third inning
Andy Pages hit two home runs for the Dodgers
Edwin Díaz got the last six outs to secure the victory
Pre-Game Insights: The Mets were determined to keep their season alive
The Mets had their best starter, Sean Manaea, ready to pitch on an extra day of rest for Game 6
The Dodgers were set to throw a bullpen game
Post-Match Reflections: The Mets' offense produced an early offensive explosion against Los Angeles Dodgers starter Jack Flaherty
The Mets had to call on their only rested high-leverage arms in the bullpen, Ryne Stanek and Edwin Díaz, for multiple innings each
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mets are here to fight for it
The Dodgers didn’t go away, though, with two Andy Pages home runs eventually bringing LA within shouting distance
Others: The Mets manager Carlos Mendoza sensed the team's determination in the pre-match hitters' meeting
The Dodgers will have to rely on their bullpen for Game 6
